oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Slide Collection - Street Scene, Deaderick Street at Third Avenue North
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The corner of Deaderick Street and the Public Square was home to Gilbert's Clothing Store for around fifty years. In 1956, Friedman's Loan Company moved into the vacated building from their longtime location further up Deaderick Street. 35 mm
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gilbert's Clothing Store; Friedman's Loan Company
Capital City; Popular Culture; Shopping; Architecture; Buildings
Nashville (Tenn.); Public Square; Deaderick Street
